intro: Guarea montana, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The tree is characterized by its dark, dense wood and simple, alternate leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
